solution_line_template: One half of a {total_mixture_ounce}-ounce liquid is ({proportion_per_soap})*({total_mixture_ounce})={amount_of_each_soap} ounces.

{amount_of_each_soap} ounce of Dawn liquid soap can make ({amount_of_each_soap})*{dawn_bubbles_per_ounce}=<<({amount_of_each_soap})*{dawn_bubbles_per_ounce}={dawn_bubbles_from_mixture}>>{dawn_bubbles_from_mixture} bubbles.
{amount_of_each_soap} ounce of Dr. Bronner's liquid soap can make {dr_bronners_multiplier}*({amount_of_each_soap})*{dawn_bubbles_per_ounce}={dr_bronners_bubbles_from_mixture} bubbles.

Therefore, a half ounce of an equal mixture of Dawn and Dr. Bronner's liquid soaps can make {dawn_bubbles_from_mixture}+{dr_bronners_bubbles_from_mixture}=<<{dawn_bubbles_from_mixture}+{dr_bronners_bubbles_from_mixture}={total_bubbles}>>{total_bubbles} bubbles.
